review: I received my Fire Stick and was very pleased with the ease of installation.  For the first day, it worked just great.  Loved it - told my family and friends all about it.  Second day, no video.  I get the blue screen indicating "HDCP unauthorized.  Content disabled." Spent about an hour and a half trying to fix it with tech support on the line.  Tried all kinds of things, nothing worked.  Amazon is sending a new one.  However, I checked this error on the internet and found that this error is occurring quite a bit with Fire Sticks - there are many frustrated customers commenting about it.  Surprisingly, although this error has been noted on the internet for a couple of months, tech support knew nothing about it.  Absolutely loved it while it worked, but am now very disappointed.
author: Cynthia Villa

review: I find the home screen much too cluttered and not user friendly.  Search feature (when typing in a movie or actor name) is glitchy and I often end up with 3 of the same letters when I only want one; I then have to waste too much time deleting and retyping.  I wish the remote had a "back 30 seconds" feature.  I'm willing to give it more time, but so far, in my playing around with it, I can say I expected more of the Amazon Fire stick.  I much prefer my Roku 3. Also, the sound drops out for a second or two a few times during everything I've watched so far.  This doesn't happen with Roku or Apple TV?  I will update my review in a month or so after I've spent more time with it.
author: Nutmegger

review: Very useful, I paid 20 dollars when it was on preorder and it was worth every penny. It is almost the exact same as the fire TV but 80$ less. The only difference I've noticed as an owner of both is speed. The fire TV is faster and has a better remote but that's it. If I were to recommend one or the other I would recommend the stick
